docs.title: Metrics
docs.text:
PySpigot uses bStats to collect anonymous usage data for PySpigot. I use these data to inform me about PySpigot's users, including which country they are from (so that I can offer support in popular non-English languages) as well as what Minecraft and Java versions are most popular with users. bStats also collects some other useful data, including server software (Spigot, Paper, Purpur, etc.), plugin version, and number of scripts loaded. Sensitive or identifying information is not collected.

If you would like to opt out of this feature, set metrics-enabled to false in PySpigot's config file. Alternatively, you can disable bStats server-wide by setting enabled to false in /plugins/bStats/config.yml.

docs.title: Connecting to the network
docs.text: Each server has a seperate IP you can use to connect to it. These are listed at the top of each server's page, there is also a general IP to rejoin the last server you joined.

docs.title: Main IP
docs.text:
play.afterbloom.net

The java port is 25565 (default)

The bedrock port is 19163 (default)

docs.title: overview
docs.text:
The technical server is a vanilla style server with normal worlds. It runs fabric so all mechanics are vanilla, there are a few mods which you can use detailed and linked below:

Jade - Server & Client side - similar to WAILA (what am I looking at), provides details of blocks and entities you look at - CalcMod - Server side - Server side mod for general calculations
